intro: Hieracium chlorophanifolium, commonly known as the green-leafed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
